    UK Touring Essentials

    What to pack, expect, and prepare for on the road

    UK Touring Essentials

    Everything you need to tour the UK in a motorhome ‚Äî from gear to etiquette.

    üß≠ Navigation & Planning

    • Paper road atlas ‚Äì Satnavs fail. Paper doesn‚Äôt.
    • Motorhome-friendly satnav or app ‚Äì Avoid low bridges and narrow lanes.
    • Camping and Caravanning Club membership ‚Äì Access to CLs and discounts.
    • Route planner ‚Äì Know your fuel stops, pitch times, and backup sites.

    üõ£Ô∏è Driving in the UK

    • Watch for width restrictions ‚Äì Especially in villages and coastal roads.
    • Know your weight limits ‚Äì Some bridges and lanes have strict limits.
    • Use lay-bys wisely ‚Äì Great for breaks, not for overnighting.
    • Be courteous ‚Äì Pull over to let faster traffic pass when safe.

    üèïÔ∏è Campsite Kit

    • Electric hookup cable (25m) ‚Äì Some pitches are awkwardly placed.
    • Levelling ramps ‚Äì UK pitches are rarely flat.
    • Waste water container ‚Äì Many sites require one.
    • Toilet chemicals ‚Äì Essential for cassette toilets.
    • Awning or windbreak ‚Äì Optional, but great for privacy and shelter.

    üåßÔ∏è Weather-Proofing

    • Thermal blinds or screens ‚Äì Keeps warmth in and condensation out.
    • Decent waterproofs ‚Äì For you and your gear.
    • Boot tray or mat ‚Äì UK = mud. Always.
    • Umbrella ‚Äì Not just for walking ‚Äî handy for outdoor cooking too.

    üç≥ Kitchen & Food

    • Gas bottle check ‚Äì Refill before you run out in the Highlands.
    • Stackable cookware ‚Äì Saves space, works well.
    • Local produce bag ‚Äì Farmers markets are everywhere.
    • Thermal mugs ‚Äì For chilly mornings and scenic lay-bys.

    üßº Comfort & Cleanliness

    • Microfibre cloths ‚Äì For condensation, spills, and everything else.
    • Hooks & suction cups ‚Äì For towels, coats, and fairy lights.
    • Laundry bag ‚Äì Keep the pong contained.
    • Doormat ‚Äì Keeps the inside cleaner, longer.

    üß∞ Tools & Spares

    • Basic toolkit ‚Äì Screwdrivers, duct tape, cable ties.
    • Spare fuses & bulbs ‚Äì For quick fixes.
    • Tyre pressure gauge ‚Äì Especially before long drives.
    • Torch or headlamp ‚Äì For late-night pitch setups or fuse checks.

    üßÉ Nice-to-Haves

    • Fairy lights or lanterns ‚Äì Instant atmosphere.
    • Folding chairs & table ‚Äì For al fresco everything.
    • Bluetooth speaker ‚Äì For tunes at the pitch.
    • Bin bags & recycling tubs ‚Äì Many sites expect you to sort waste.
